paragraphs.text: [On p. 43 supra I omitted to direct attention to the desirable enlargement of[fn-9-P908_238641:167-nf] by a reference to Homer's Hymn of Mercury and its minute description of the invention of the Lyre. The passage is given in Henry Nelson Coleridge's Introduction, etc., p.202. The versified translation of Shelley is inimitable; in ottava rima, but instinct with the ethos of the original.]
